author: MENAFN
title: Stepping Stones For Wildlife: How Linking Up Isolated Habitats Can Help Nature Thrive In Our Cities
text:
( MENAFN - The Conversation) Imagine you're a fairywren living in a patch of scrub behind a schoolyard in the suburbs. It's been pretty nice so far, but a recent increase in neighbourhood cats and the council's insect control tactics mean it's time to look for somewhere safer to live.
There's a problem, though. You're a small, bright blue bird that tends to make short flights from shrub to shrub, staying safe in the foliage. Beyond your little patch of habitat, there don't seem to be any places you can easily access. On one side are wide-open sportsfields; on the other, a busy six-lane road. Where do you go?
It's a bad situation for a fairywren, and for many other native species in cities. In ecology, we call this habitat fragmentation.
The map of suitable habitat for city-dwelling wildlife often looks like a scattering of islands in an inhospitable sea of other land uses. These species face threats or barriers such as roads, buildings, fences and feral predators. This poses several issues, such as barring access to feeding areas, increasing competition for nesting spaces within habitat patches and even reducing gene flow by making it hard to find mates.
Our newly published research shows how native species in our cities can benefit if we focus on creating strategically located green spaces to connect isolated patches of habitat.
Native species are at risk whenever they venture beyond the safety of urban habitat patches. MomentsForZen/Flickr , CC BY-NC-ND Why we should care for urban species Despite the myriad challenges facing plants, animals and insects in urban areas, cities are important places to take care of our native species. Urban areas still offer valuable nesting and feeding resources, especially for tree-dwelling mammals, canopy-feeding birds and water-adapted species.
In addition to their value for conservation , urban habitats are precious spaces for people to encounter nature in the places we live and work . Urban nature has been shown to be important in balancing out the stresses of city life, particularly in disadvantaged communities . It's also good for our physical health and social connectedness – it even improves cognitive development in children .
Unsurprisingly, studies have shown people want more nature in their cities.
But actively supporting native species hasn't generally been the norm in many cities. The practice of planning and design to deliberately bring nature back into urban areas is still developing. Our open-access research paper in Landscape and Urban Planning offers insights into how we can tackle one aspect of the problem: habitat fragmentation.
Thami Croeser explains the research findings on how best to create links between fragmented wildlife habitat. What did the study look at? We examined how greening projects could best connect up habitat for New Holland honeyeaters (Phylidonyris novaehollandiae), blue-banded bees (Amegilla spp) and mole crickets (Gryllotalpa spp) in Melbourne, Victoria. These are all species that occur locally but experience some degree of habitat fragmentation.
We have a lot of greening to do for climate adaptation and to create open space for new residents in our growing cities. What if we could also do this greening in a way that boosts habitat for non-human residents too?
We compared a scenario where a large number of small green spaces (formerly parking spaces) were created mainly for climate adaptation purposes, to a pair of scenarios where a smaller number of green spaces were created exclusively in areas that had been identified as key links between habitat fragments.
Maps showing the areas targeted for creating green spaces to link fragmented patches of habitat. T. Croeser et al 2024 , CC BY What were the findings? In total, the benefit of each space in the targeted scenario was more than double that of the scenario where we placed green spaces for climate adaptation purposes, even with the same design of individual green spaces.
Here's an image of the kind of green spaces we modelled in this study.
A biodiverse green space with a street tree (1), habitat resources such as understorey plants (2) and stormwater infiltration using a sunken 'raingarden' design (3) effectively de-paves the area of the parking space (4). T. Croeser et al 2022 , CC BY We found significant benefits for two of our three species when green spaces were located in a way that specifically targeted habitat connections.
Blue-banded bees and mole crickets did especially well. It is trickier for these small creatures to navigate the space between habitat patches. When these small green spaces provided“stepping stones” between bigger patches, they greatly increased the area of habitat a bee or cricket could reach.
Blue-banded bees greatly benefited from creating green spaces to connect isolated patches of habitat. AjayTvm/Shutterstock
Mole crickets aren't made for travelling long distances between areas of suitable habitat. Donald Hobern/Flickr , CC BY Linking up habitats when we create new green spaces is one way to give native species a chance in our cities. It also gives us (and our kids) a better chance of having everyday nature experiences.
Of course, adding this“ecosystem connectivity” lens to our green space planning isn't a biodiversity panacea. We'll still need to deliver a lot of new greenery.
And we'll have to design it carefully to support native animals while also providing cooling, reduced flood risk and recreational spaces. We also need to make sure we're picking the right species to model our maps on, and then design our spaces for.
Still, if we get this right, that fairywren might just one day have small, green“stepping stones” to find their way around the city to a happy new home.
MENAFN19072024000199003603ID1108458034

author: Dominic Sanders
title: Birmingham Schools Lead in Mathematics Recovery Efforts - Investors Hangout
text: Birmingham Schools Lead in Mathematics Recovery Efforts [Dominic Sanders](https://investorshangout.com/profile/view?id=79424)Updated: 09-19-2024 03:54 PM Birmingham City Schools' Mathematics Recovery Success Birmingham City Schools (BCS) has emerged as a frontrunner in Alabama for mathematics recovery, boasting a significant increase in overall student achievement. In just one academic year, the students at BCS have improved their mathematics performance by half a grade level equivalent, a commendable feat considering the national context of stagnant academic recovery. Closing the Achievement Gaps Despite the nationwide struggles faced by many school districts, BCS stands out by effectively closing learning gaps for its students. Analysis shows that among Council of the Great City Schools (CGCS) districts, BCS is leading efforts to enhance mathematics proficiency, particularly for students coming from economically disadvantaged backgrounds. Statewide Progress in Mathematics Research covering 8,000 school districts across 30 states has revealed a notable statistic: Alabama is the only state where students' average mathematics proficiency has surpassed pre-pandemic levels. This achievement sets BCS apart as a beacon of hope and progress, particularly as 87% of its student body faces socioeconomic challenges. A Collaborative Approach to Education Kelly-Ann Parson, sales director at Curriculum Associates, emphasizes the importance of BCS's innovative strategies in supporting student learning. She states, "We are inspired by the district's dedication to finding new ways to support its students and educators, and it is our privilege to partner with BCS to continue improving student outcomes." This partnership has empowered BCS to implement various programs that cater to diverse educational needs. Remarkable Growth in Student Performance The academic year between 2022 and 2023 saw a four-percentage point increase in the number of BCS students classified as 'on track' or 'mastered' on the Alabama Comprehensive Assessment Program in Mathematics. The impressive growth of 6.6 percentage points in Grade 3 and 7.2 percentage points in Grade 7 serves as a testament to the effectiveness of the targeted interventions BCS has established. Support Initiatives and Collaborations Superintendent Mark Sullivan highlighted that BCS aimed to build a robust support structure for its students. This included enrolling students in enrichment sessions, utilizing wraparound services, and collaborating with local universities to provide high-intensity tutoring. Such initiatives illustrate BCS's commitment to addressing unique educational challenges head-on. Utilizing Innovative Educational Tools Council of the Great City Schools students constitute a large portion of i-Ready users, which enhances their learning experience. With nearly 2.5 million students in Grades K–8 accessing this digital platform, the effectiveness of data-driven instruction is evident. Notably, 95% of CGCS member districts with mathematics data have surpassed national averages in terms of post-pandemic recovery. Looking Ahead for Academic Success The strides made by Birmingham City Schools in mathematics recovery serve as an inspiring model for other districts across the country. By actively working to overcome educational disparities and engaging in meaningful partnerships, schools like BCS are setting the standard for what is possible in public education. Frequently Asked Questions What recent improvements have been made in Birmingham City Schools? Birmingham City Schools has achieved significant growth in mathematics, with improvements in student performance of half a grade level equivalent over the past year. How does Birmingham City Schools assist its economically disadvantaged students? BCS provides various support services, enrichment sessions, and partnerships with local universities to engage students in high-intensity tutoring. What is the significance of the i-Ready platform for schools? The i-Ready platform is widely used by students in CGCS districts, helping them to improve their learning outcomes through data-driven instruction. How has Alabama performed compared to other states post-pandemic? Alabama is noted as the only state where students' average mathematics proficiency exceeds pre-pandemic levels, marking it as a leader in educational recovery. What role does Curriculum Associates play in BCS's success? Curriculum Associates partners with BCS to provide resources and innovative strategies aimed at fostering improved educational outcomes for all students. author: Rafaela Dionello, sob supervisão de Priscilla Comoti
title: Megan Fox aparece em foto sem maquiagem e impressiona web: 'Quem é essa?'
text: Megan Fox surpreendeu ao um clique natural nas redes sociais nesta quinta-feira, 18, e chocou seus seguidores com aparência por Rafaela Dionello, sob supervisão de Priscilla Comoti Publicado em 18/04/2024, às 17h57 Megan Fox surpreendeu seus seguidores ao postar uma foto com um visual diferente do que eles estão acostumados em um clique no espelho e confundiu seguidores. A artista geralmente aposta em mega produções de maquiagem e encantou seguidores com um registro do rosto limpo, mas também os deixou confusos: "Quem é essa?", comentou um fã. A artista surgiu no Instagram com uma calça de pijama e um sutiã preto, com os cabelos soltos e de cara limpa. Na legenda, a artista contou que estava passando por um processo de reparação do cabelo e de suas extensões, brincou ela - que estão em um tom de azul bebê. "Enquanto mais ela envelhece, mais nova ela fica. Como isso é possível?", escreveu uma seguidora. "Você não é a Megan Fox", criticou um internauta, "Megan não pode fazer anda sem que as pessoas tentam deixá-la para baixo. Faça o que acha melhor, garota. Você está fabulosa assim", rebateu uma fã da artista, “Você é linda sempre”, declarou uma outra. Ver essa foto no Instagram Recentemente, Megan participou do podcast Call Her Daddye falou sobre as polêmicas envolvendo cirurgia plástica . Aos 37 anos e mãe de 3 filhos, ela conta que já aplicou botox e preenchimento no rosto, a fim de combater a flacidez e estimular a produção de colágeno. E ainda, de acordo com a atriz, já foram investidos US$ 30 mil, – cerca de R$ 150 mil – em silicone nos seios. “[Meus seios] são falsos desde que eu tinha 21 ou 22 anos. Eu fiz plástica entre o primeiro e o segundo Transformers. Mas eu fiz de forma conservadora, porque naquela época todo mundo colocava os implantes, mas era preciso fazer algo que fosse imperceptível”, iniciou ela. “Não fiquei feliz com o primeiro implante. Mandei refazê-los depois que terminei de amamentar meus filhos, porque não sei para onde meus seios foram, mas foram embora. Então tive que refazê-los muito recentemente porque na primeira vez eu não tinha gordura corporal suficiente para disfarçar – dava para ver a ondulação dos implantes”, revelou. Para completar, ela revelou que ainda deseja fazer intevenções em seu bumbum. "Como se eu fosse caminhar por um parque, e me virasse e todos estivessem sussurrando, rindo e conversando porque eles dizem 'O quê?' como se eu fosse uma aberração de circo", comentou. Megan ainda completou o assunto dizendo que não fez mais procedimentos ainda porque sente medo de anestesia.

author: Get News
title: Executive Producer, Connie Fox, Debuts A New Retirement Documentary | Markets | bigspringherald.com
text:
New Documentary, The Retirement Deception, Sheds New Light On Retirement In the compelling documentary, "The Retirement Deception," executive producer, Connie Fox, takes a stand against the misleading narratives surrounding retirement planning.
Best-selling authors and producers, Brett Kitchen and Ethan Kap, journey over 18,000 miles to delve into the lives of real American retirees, uncovering the true essence of what constitutes a happy and successful retirement.
This film boldly challenges the entrenched beliefs and strategies touted by financial experts and questions the effectiveness of Wall Street's favorite retirement-building strategy of investing all of your money in a fluctuating stock market. Instead, "The Retirement Deception" seeks to uncover the real keys to a successful retirement. Questioning whether it is amassing a large nest egg, securing high investment returns, or finding a brilliant financial advisor, that results in income and happiness during retirement, or if it is something else altogether?
Through their journey, Kitchen and Kap bring to light stories from retirees who have strayed from Wall Street's conventional playbook. These narratives present a more layered and honest perspective on what it really takes to achieve financial security and emotional well-being in retirement.
"The Retirement Deception" proposes a refreshing viewpoint, suggesting that a fulfilling retirement is not solely dependent on wealth. The documentary offers a window into the lives of ordinary Americans who have triumphed over typical retirement challenges like inflation, market volatility, taxes, and longevity.
This film is a must-see for anyone planning for or considering retirement. For a sneak peek, visit retirementdeception.com to view the trailer.

author: VNExplorer
title: Viale Campania resta chiuso un altro mese, la pioggia ha allagato il cantiere
text:
Viale Campania resta chiuso un altro mese, la pioggia ha allagato il cantiere
Ritardi per i lavori di ripristino del collettore di viale Campania: il tratto compreso tra l’intersezione con via Teano/Tronto/Verbano (all’altezza del civico 64) e via Philips non riaprirà entro fine mese, come inizialmente previsto. BrianzAcque ha comunicato che per arrivare a conclusione bisognerà attendere la seconda metà di aprile, a causa delle condizioni di pioggia che hanno caratterizzato la fine di febbraio e la prima decade di marzo, con allagamenti a piò riprese del cantiere.
«Le due settimane di piogge hanno rallentato i lavori – comunicano dalla societÃ -. Ora grazie al bel tempo, sono state apposte le travi che sosterranno la copertura del manufatto”. Fino ad allora, come dal 19 gennaio a questa parte, resterÃ pertanto solo una la corsia di viale Campania aperta al traffico. Intanto lâ€™attivitÃ di ripristino di BrianzAcque ha ripreso con slancio, con una “task force” di circa venti persone al giorno tra operai, progettisti e direttori dei lavori impegnati in cantiere, avviandosi verso lo step conclusivo di un intervento non semplice, considerando che il tratto di collettore fognario da ripristinare â€“ che ha causato un enorme voragine in strada lo scorso 31 dicembre â€“ Ã¨ un manufatto di 2 metri per 3, di produzione artigianale (tra i piÃ¹ grandi della cittÃ ), con una portata tra i 300 e 350 litri al secondo in assenza di pioggia, e che va allocato a una profonditÃ di 7 metri.
Martedì le imprese hanno gettato le travi in cemento armato destinate a sostenere la soletta di copertura del manufatto realizzato ad hoc in corrispondenza del punto di collassamento della tubazione che, dal Nord della Brianza, piega su viale Campania fino a raggiungere il depuratore di San Rocco. Per far sì che il calcestruzzo possa arrivare a “maturazione“ e reggere i carichi della strada servono 28 giorni, trascorsi i quali la “cameretta“ sarà coperta e chiusa con lastre prefabbricate. Sarà il passaggio finale che consentirà il rinterro, l’asfaltatura e la riapertura del viale alla circolazione in tutte e quattro le corsie di marcia. L’intervento per riparare la spalla del collettore si è svolto in più fasi che hanno visto la realizzazione di una struttura di micropali per la messa in sicurezza dell’area e la realizzazione della cameretta di 6 metri per 5.

author: Newsroom Infobae
title: Biden muestra gratitud a los tres militares fallecidos en el accidente de helicóptero en la frontera con México
text:
El presidente de Estados Unidos, Joe Biden, ha mostrado su gratitud a los dos miembros de la Guardia Nacional y al agente de la Patrulla Fronteriza que fallecieron el viernes por la noche tras estrellarse el helicóptero en el que viajaban cerca de la frontera con México. "Ayer, Jill y yo nos enteramos de la trágica muerte de dos miembros de la Guardia Nacional y un agente de la Patrulla Fronteriza de Estados Unidos cuyo helicóptero se estrelló mientras realizaban operaciones de rutina cerca de Rio Grande, en Texas. Un tercer guardia resultó gravemente herido en el accidente y está hospitalizado", ha relatado Biden en un comunicado compartido por la Casa Blanca. Ha añadido que "estos valientes estadounidenses dedicaron sus vidas a proteger nuestra nación. Se inscribieron conociendo los riesgos y creyendo en la misión de servir a sus compatriotas manteniendo nuestra nación segura. Nuestra gratitud es profunda y su sacrificio nunca será olvidado". Por esta razón, ha extendido su "más sentido pésame" a familiares, seres queridos y compañeros de trabajo y va a rezar por una rápida recuperación para el guardia herido. "Mientras investigamos las circunstancias de este accidente, seguimos apoyando a nuestros miembros del servicio, agentes fronterizos y sus familias, cuyas contribuciones a nuestra nación son vitales para nuestra seguridad", ha finalizado.
Biden muestra gratitud a los tres militares fallecidos en el accidente de helicóptero en la frontera con México

author: Post author By corinnefiretto
title: El Condado De Union Invita a Los Residentes a Capturar Las Maravillas Del Mundo Natural
text:
La Junta de Comisionados del Condado de Union se complace en anunciar que el Concurso anual de fotografía de vida silvestre ha regresado al Centro de Ciencias y Naturaleza Trailside, ubicado en el 452 New Providence Road en Mountainside. Se invita a fotógrafos aficionados de 13 años en adelante a presentar sus fotografías originales de animales salvajes en su hábitat natural.
“El Concurso de Fotografía de Vida Silvestre es un evento emocionante que permite a los miembros de nuestra comunidad mostrar sus habilidades fotográficas al capturar la belleza natural de los animales en sus hábitats”, dijo la Comisionada Presidenta Kimberly Palmieri-Mouded. “Puedes inmortalizar las criaturas peludas, aladas, reptantes o nadadoras que habitan nuestro entorno a través de los lentes de tu cámara. Diviértete expandiendo tu creatividad y pon a prueba tus habilidades. ¡Espero ver tus increíbles fotografías!”
El Concurso de Fotografía de Vida Silvestre ya está aceptando presentaciones. Las fotografías serán juzgadas por fotógrafos profesionales locales y se clasificarán según el grupo de edad: adolescentes, de 13 a 17 años, adultos, de 18 años en adelante, y personas mayores, de 55 años en adelante. Cada fotografía enviada debe ser una impresión sin marco y sin mate de 8″ x 10″, ya sea en blanco y negro o en color. Los jueces evaluarán las candidaturas en función de la originalidad, composición, excelencia técnica y mérito artístico.
Los trabajos ganadores se anunciarán en el evento anual Wild Earth Fest el domingo 28 de abril de 2024. Wild Earth Fest es un evento familiar al aire libre que presenta animales vivos, actividades para niños, educación sobre la naturaleza, comida, música y más.
Para obtener un folleto con las reglas y el formulario de inscripción para el Concurso de fotografía de vida silvestre, llame a Trailside al 908-789-3670 o visite
ucnj.org/trailside y accede al apartado de eventos de la web. Las inscripciones deben recibirse o tener matasellos a más tardar el 17 de abril de 2024.
Aparte de los programas y eventos especiales, Trailside da la bienvenida a todos los visitantes de forma gratuita todos los días de 10:00 a. m. a 4:00 p. m., excepto los lunes y feriados importantes. Para obtener más detalles sobre el Concurso de fotografía de vida silvestre y otros programas próximos en Trailside, visite
ucnj.org/trailside o llame al 908-789-3670.
Para obtener enlaces rápidos a todos los programas y actividades ambientales del Condado de Union, visite Green Connection en
ucnj.org/green-connection. Y para obtener más información sobre actividades y programas del Departamento de Parques y Recreación del Condado de Union, visite en línea ucnj.org/parks o
envíe un correo electrónico a , o llame al 908-527-4900.

author: Nelson Espinal
title: Elon Musk impersonator arrested for 'stealing $600,000 from unsuspecting Facebook user'
text:
Elon Musk impersonator arrested for 'stealing $600,000 from unsuspecting Facebook user'
The allure of a tech titan's promise led a woman down a path of deception. Her belief in a digital connection with Elon Musk unraveled into a costly scam.
An [Elon Musk](/latest/elon-musk) impersonator was arrested on suspicion of [stealing $600,000 from a woman](/news/us-news/155539/elon-musk-impersonator-arrested-stealing-600000-facebook) that he met on [Facebook](/latest/facebook), according to [police](/latest/police).
The woman genuinely thought that the person she was talking to was the honest Musk, [but it turned out to be Jeffery Moynihan, 56.](/news/us-news/155539/elon-musk-impersonator-arrested-stealing-600000-facebook)
The real Elon Musk recently [helped Alex Jones to try and save Jones's "Infowars."](/news/us-news/155057/alex-jones-inforwars-elon-musk-the-onion-trump)
[Megarocket launches for sixth time from SpaceX's Starbase in Texas](/news/space-news/155135/spacex-launch-starbase-texas-november)[Trump appoints SpaceX champion to cabinet as Musk clashes with team over picks](/news/politics/155111/trump-appoints-spacex-champion-to)
"She really thought she was friends with him, and she’d communicate with him on a daily basis with him," Detective Jim Curulla of the Bradenton Police Department’s Elder Fraud Unit told Fox News.
The Bradenton Police Department revealed that Moynihan sent messages to a 74-year-old woman for months, dating back to last year.
The suspect promised a $55 million return on investment if she bought shares of Musk's businesses to get the victim to part with her money.
The woman only managed to send $250,000 to accounts she thought were Musk's but were owned by Moyinhan or his businesses.
"What and who you see is not who is typing back to you. I think these people, you have to realize that, but even more so, you can’t give money. You can’t start going into a business dealing with someone over the internet," Detective Curulla told Fox News.
"Mr. Monihyan said his girlfriend is the mastermind behind it, and he had no involvement."
In total, the victim's husband alleges that a total of $600,000 was stolen.
